column4:
A $6.3 MILLION investment for the Hospital Service District 1 of EBR Parish from USDA.

2nd largest awarded out of 256, 1 of 6 above $30 million.

It'll renovate & expand the hospital facility & capabilities, & sustain jobs for 850 people in the area.

https://t.co/DoQxBzqngZ

Signed by POTUS, the CASES Act allows constituents to give their permission online for a member of Congress to work with a federal agency on their behalf. 

I introduced the bill with @RepJoeKennedy & the US House has now launched the digital consent form.
https://t.co/YwyoAmDIKM

On April 14, Congressmen Graves, Richmond and Scalise announced MSY was receiving $42,793,389 available through the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act. (3/3) https://t.co/3bs1jecN3J

I joined @SBAJovita, @LouisianaGov, and several other stakeholders today for a roundtable to discuss PPP, disaster assistance for the recent storms & helping our small businesses recover from COVID-19. https://t.co/belEqWYHUv

Over $2.1 million in CARES Act funding awarded to South Central Planning & Development Commission in Houma.

It will assist businesses impacted by COVID-19 in Assumption, Lafourche, St Charles, St James, St John the Baptist, St Mary & Terrebonne parishes
https://t.co/J7kimp8ydc

No matter the challenge – Spillway openings, imported products, natural disasters or a pandemic – we will be right there with our shrimpers, processors, and communities working together to provide the relief they need.

Background here: (2/2) https://t.co/78lCih9jvc

On Friday I testified at the Louisiana Economic Recovery Task Force and gave a federal update on COVID-19 relief.

We discussed the bills Congress has passed so far and the need to tailor the next round of legislation to those that need it the most. https://t.co/I9RFmxdRhj

This update is separate from last week's news regarding the Section 32 purchase of shrimp by USDA as this announcement allows the USDA Farm Service Agency to provide pandemic relief for producers that face price declines & additional marketing costs.(3/3)

https://t.co/qsC8zp9sy1

Louisiana crawfishers are feeling the heat as the pandemic has crushed demand, and CFAP is definitely not a substitute for getting our economy – or the ultimate catalyst needed to boost customer demand – back up and running. (2/3)

Louisiana crawfish is now included in USDA's CFAP program.

This is part of the larger effort to keep Louisiana’s seafood industries afloat amidst COVID-19. (1/3)

https://t.co/b4Ix5Fw1y5

This is a win-win-win for Louisiana’s consumers, families and local fishermen as COVID-19 has impacted everyone across the board. 

For many families across Louisiana, this will help feed food banks, schools and households. (1/2) https://t.co/voDKjrS3Gg

We‘re still hurting from the Spillway opening last year & COVID-19 has made matters worse. 

Today’s announcement will absolutely help bridge the gap between further loss for our processors & fleet, & be the lifeline needed to stay afloat until our economy is back on track. (3/5) https://t.co/FKzFIN0yQZ

Protecting small businesses from frivolous lawsuits as they reopen to serve our communities must be a key piece of the next COVID-19 relief package. 

My bill provides a bipartisan framework & I look forward to working with my colleagues in the House & Senate to find a solution. https://t.co/QTe0mVF4ZM

Unemployment assistance, job opportunities, improving schools & medical care for our seniors - all on the back burner for an enviro-bailout. #GAOA #LWCF

We've prioritized a tone-deaf bill as "mandatory spending" amidst a global pandemic. 

Read more: 
https://t.co/3qKjjQ9HmP

Quick, there's a global pandemic.

Let's spend billions of dollars - repairing fences, putting up new signs, fixing toilets - at wildlife refuges, parks & forests. 

Said no one ever. 

This bill puts everything else on the back burner. 

#GAOA #LWCF 

https://t.co/mc0N3zWy4K

Providing legal safe harbor against frivolous lawsuits for small businesses as they reopen must be a key component of the next COVID-19 package. 

Below, @BPC_Bipartisan affirms to congressional leadership the protection my liability bill would offer. https://t.co/88fJjVWDVk

An enviro-bailout (at the cost of LA’s coast & future) is being pushed amidst COVID-19, oil price war, record unemployment, & national civil unrest. 

Gulf Coast hurricane protection will be sacrificed for parks out West if @OutdoorsAct passes. 

#FundLWCF #RestoreOurParks #GAOA https://t.co/IJAgROIius

Great to join LA Congressional Delegation members in welcoming @Mike_Pence to Louisiana this morning to discuss LA’s COVID-19 response. 

I was also able to hitch a ride back tonight on Air Force Two to DC & talk legislative priorities for South Louisiana. https://t.co/J4W1iSBIt0

Met with FEMA Administrator Pete Gaynor this morning to talk flood recovery with the Baker School System leadership.

We also discussed COVID-related food insecurity, Duplication of Benefits, and flood protection. https://t.co/ZUkQXSZqbn
The bipartisan bill protects businesses and their employees from being sued provided they took reasonable steps to comply with the guidance from the CDC or appropriate health authorities.

Small businesses & their hard workers need to reopen without the threat of frivolous lawsuits associated with COVID-19.

I introduced a bipartisan bill this week to offer this protection at the federal level. https://t.co/opo5U1MJNb

The #GreatAmericanOutdoorsAct. The fact that the Senate is prioritizing an enviro-bailout right now – amidst record unemployment, a pandemic and national civil unrest – is fascinating. 

 (1/ 7) https://t.co/o1NayQSPgp

Baton Rouge receiving a $1.6 Million CARES Act Grant award to support homeless families and individuals who have been affected by COVID-19 in Baton Rouge. Louisiana's total share of this funding is $20,923,237.

More here:

https://t.co/kmfUrccYxC

Joined LA’s congressional delegation in support of Gov. Edwards’ request to POTUS to ensure Louisiana National Guard remains active through July 31, 2020 in our response to the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/m6P6xA4RE9

Nearly $100 mil awarded to help protect LA senior citizens from COVID-19. 

Each of these senior citizens is someone’s parent, grandparent, relative or lifelong friend that has become part of one of the most vulnerable populations - not just stats. 

https://t.co/WOREcgEcSa

NEW - $190 mil from HHS to boost COVID-19 testing in Louisiana. This record investment will help us to reopen quicker & safely. We need to focus on reopening, economic recovery, and getting our families working again - not prolonged decline.

More below: 

https://t.co/QFbe6pOygs
Just last week, we wrote to @FERChatterjee to show there is unrelated attacks on US energy independence which has no place during COVID-19. (2/2) https://t.co/vEGRshefRg

Explanation - These allocations are based on harvest. The west coast, which sucked up all the previous funding, experiences their main fishery season during the early spring & winter so their losses right now are larger due to COVID. (2/3)

NEWS - $2.3 Million provided to LA-06 to expand COVID-19 testing from HHS. 

This funding for health centers is part of H.R. 266 – The Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act, signed into law by POTUS on April 24th. 

More below👇

https://t.co/gyIuq97caI

Joined LA congressmen in sending a letter to Gov. Edwards today urging him to apply federal coronavirus reopening guidelines on a local or regional basis. We highlighted that maintaining a statewide shutdown is causing undue harm to Louisiana families.  

https://t.co/1aYHIcJbbj
Provided any new petition in the Legislature results in compliance with CDC guidance and allows local govts to open when appropriate, fully support it.  Will NOT jeopardize federal funding.

We need to reopen those regions/communities in our state that meet WH/CDC guidance.  Applying blanket guidance to entire state is hurting our working families and small businesses.  I support Louisiana Legislature or JBE making the changes needed now to make this happen. https://t.co/UkfeyZfzzd

READ: Letter to POTUS urging him to ensure DOBs don’t become an issue for any LA business that uses the SBA during the COVID-19 crisis. Facebook Live TODAY:

Hosting with @SBAsouthcentral Regional Administrator, Justin Crossie, to discuss SBA capabilities during the COVID-19 recovery process. 

We will discuss what SBA Economic Injury Disaster Loans entail & how we can help small businesses across the LA recover. https://t.co/zyD88bQ9zk
✅YES Vote on Coronavirus Funds. I am glad, and shocked, that Democrats came together with Republicans, putting aside politics for a second, to deliver a clean piece of policy.
